intro: Pogostemon fauriei, commonly known as the Java mint, is a perennial herb native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and small, pale purple flowers that bloom in spikes. The plant has a square stem and is often found growing in moist, shaded environments. It is valued for its medicinal properties and is used in traditional medicine for its antiseptic and anti-inflammatory effects. Pogostemon fauriei is also popular as a ornamental plant due to its fragrant foliage and easy care requirements.
